Comments_List: Inference and statistical theories.
This course gave me a general idea of statistical inference and decision theories.
Important topics and theories about statistical inference.
Inference
Knowledge about estimators and properties of estimators.
I systematically learnt statistical inference with popular methods and applications.
I learn a lot about important statistical inference topics, like min max rate, Bayesian, etc.
Absolutely great class.
Very clear lessons and notes.

The course was well organized. Course contents were really important and useful statistical topics. However, given the level of difficulty of the topics, I feel the course went to fast that it's hard to absorb the details.
Only cover a small part of the textbook

The challenging problem sets and take-home exams are, unquestionably, the best part of this course. While struggling to solve the problem sets, I learned many interesting ways to handle theoretical questions in Statistics. Moreover, both take-home exams were extremely challenging and exciting!

With respect to the problem sets, I have only one suggestion: providing solutions to the exercises would be very useful for the students' learning process.

The main weakness of this course is that, frequently, the lecture time was dedicated to solve very simple questions or to give multiple examples about one topic. Dedicating more time to complicated proofs and general examples may be more efficient than showing several simple cases.
This class is very well organized, and the material covered should be very good foundation for further study of statistics. I can't really think of any weakness of this class.
This course has good coverage of knowledge including theory and applications. It will be better if more cases of applications are introduced.
I think it's better to give official ans to the assignments.
Very useful and enjoyable!
Yes

I would recommend this course to PhD students or others with great interest in academia, since the course material are important and fundamental statistical topics. I would probably not recommend this course to others, because it was a hard course!
yes

If the student is interested in theoretical Statistics or Theoretical Econometrics (my case), this is a very useful course, because it covers many topics that are either very fundamental in Mathematical Statistics or not standard in Economics (e.g.: Bayesian methods).
I highly recommend this class to any student interested in theoretical statistics. Harry is a great instructor, too.
I think this is a suitable course for solidification of statistics knowledge.
Absolutely yes.
